publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

msIdentifier.repository: Private collection of Dr. Carl Heinz and Jutta Neukirchen
msIdentifier.idno: Private collection of Dr. Carl Heinz and Jutta Neukirchen 004

extent.note: Data on leaves dimensions taken from .

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in pencil in the middle of the bottom margin of the folio. This is the foliation used as reference in this record.
supportDesc.condition: Stains of water and dirt, the binding and text block are damaged by insects. The inner part of the leather cover of the front board is partially lost; textile inlays are rubbed off. The spine is torn; the leather cover is rubbed.

handNote.seg: First one or two lines in the beginning of the text and text sections; numerals; punctuation marks; name of God, Mary, and angels; single letters and words.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the with four Evangelists depicted as Four Beasts.
A miniature of with an eagle.

item.desc: A crude unfinished drawing of an animal.
Later corrections in purple and pink pencils.
Text added in the upper margin.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with blind-tooled leather. Purple textile inlays.

history.acquisition: The manuscript was acquired by Dr Carl Heinz and Jutta Neukirchen during their stay in Ethiopia in 1963-1966.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: Created entry, added physical description and content.
